CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 11, 1955, pg. 12, reads: "Madhatters' Winners - The above picture shows the winners of the Madhatters' Cabaret Ball given by the Charmers Club of Pittsburgh, on Saturday, June 4. The affair was held at the VFW (Dutch Henry's). Left to right: Curalie Taylor, club's president; Dorothy Silvers, prize winner in the ladies hat competition. Alfred Carl, first prize for most original bow tie. Judges: Mrs. Earsley Kincaid and Roland Sawyer. Music by Art Nance and his Four Deuces. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Unknown man wearing tie with horses, Alfred Carl wearing large bow tie, Dorothy Silvers receiving award for hat competition from Roland Sawyer, Curalie Taylor, and Earsley Kincaid in back, at Madhatters' Cabaret Ball, with Art Nance and his Four Deuces band in background, VFW post 740, 328 Forbes Avenue
